instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924 Graphics Issue
threads.message:
Hello,

820-4924 that will not boot - once the loading bar is 1/4 there are graphical artifacts in various colors and it hangs. 
There was liquid damage that appeared to be minor, corrosion had eaten pin 13 of U1900, so replaced that chip, and there did not appear to be any other damage.
It will run the internal diagnostics and show no issues.

Anyone have any ideas?

threads.title: 820-4924 Graphics Issue
threads.message: water damage somewhere, maybe under CPU or RAM...

threads.title: 820-4924 Graphics Issue
threads.message:
I have cleaned several times in the UC with no change. I don't want to pull ram chips off to look for issues.
Could this be a system clock issue? It will option boot and run EFI diagnostics. It will even boot tot the filevault unlock screen, it tanks after it actually boots OS.
Could this be a bios issue?

threads.title: 820-4924 Graphics Issue
threads.message:
I'm with aprendiz on this one. 

I've not come across BIOS issues causing this type of problem. I'd even say reflow the SMC with a good flux.
